decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use powerful Eldrazi creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan and cards like Grim Monolith to ramp into big threats early on, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Ugin, the Ineffable and All Is Dust provide additional board control options, while cards like Walking Ballista and Endbringer offer versatile threats to deal with various situations.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in order to win the game quickly. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to search for the combo pieces, while also using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to control the opponent's hand. The deck also includes efficient removal in the form of Abrupt Decay and a toolbox of lands to support the combo strategy, making it a versatile and powerful deck in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to control the board through counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push. The deck also utilizes card draw and filtering with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary threats and answers. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive and disruptive strategy.

The main focus of this Legacy deck is to quickly burn the opponent's life total down to zero using a combination of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing efficient burn spells like Price of Progress, Lightning Bolt, and Fireblast, along with fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, the deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel helps to punish opponents for playing spells, further supporting the aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana and cast multiple spells in a single turn to build towards a lethal Tendrils of Agony finish. The deck uses cards like Lotus Petal, Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual to generate mana, while spells like Brainstorm, Preordain, Ponder, and Infernal Tutor allow you to dig for the pieces you need. Thoughtseize, Duress, and Ad Nauseam help disrupt your opponent's game plan while Past in Flames and Dark Petition provide additional ways to find and cast your win condition.

The main strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while aggressively attacking with efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mirran Crusader. Using cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, the deck aims to control the tempo of the game and quickly close out with evasive threats. With disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Wasteland, this deck is designed to punish opponents for relying on powerful noncreature spells or greedy mana bases.

The primary strategy of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Delver of Secrets early on, supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to control the game. The deck aims to maintain a low life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, while also utilizing card draw and searching effects to ensure consistency in hand management. Wasteland is included to disrupt the opponent's mana base, while the deck also has options for reanimation and removal to deal with threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wrenn and Six, along with efficient removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. It also includes card advantage generators like Ponder and Brainstorm to maintain control of the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Force of Negation while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dreadhorde Arcanist to close out the game. The inclusion of counterspells and additional removal spells adds to the deck's strong control elements.

This Canadian Threshold Aggro deck focuses on efficiently disrupting opponent's plays while deploying threats that quickly close out the game. It aims to control the board through countermagic and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stifle, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck's strategy revolves around tempo plays, utilizing cards that can both disrupt the opponent's game plan and advance its own board state. The inclusion of cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns adds versatility and additional threats to the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill out opponents quickly. It also utilizes cards like Blood Moon and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponents' strategies and control the board. The deck includes various artifact tutors and mana accelerants to help assemble the combo quickly, while also having answers like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to protect itself. Additionally, cards like Goblin Welder and Daretti, Ingenious Iconoclast add extra versatility and value to the deck. Overall, this deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo and disrupt opponents to secure a win.

The deck revolves around utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with key cards such as Golgari Grave-Troll and Bridge from Below. By discarding cards and dredging instead of drawing, the deck aims to create a massive army of tokens, disrupt the opponent's hand with Cabal Therapy, and eventually bring out powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck also includes cards like Lion's Eye Diamond to quickly generate mana for explosive plays, making it a potent combo deck in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with infect creatures such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, supported by pump spells like Berserk and Invigorate. The deck aims to win the game by dealing 10 poison counters to the opponent before traditional damage can be dealt. The deck also includes various protection spells like Force of Will and Vines of Vastwood to ensure the infect creatures can get through and deliver lethal damage. The mana base is designed to support the combo with access to both blue and green mana sources.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana by utilizing Elves and Gaea's Cradle, then use that mana to quickly cast powerful creatures such as Craterhoof Behemoth and Archon of Valor's Reach. The deck also includes several ways to draw cards and tutor for specific creatures, allowing for consistent and explosive combo plays. The combination of mana acceleration and creature synergy makes this deck a potent force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck is focused on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, and then bringing them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to reanimate high-impact creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider, generating a powerful advantage over the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual help accelerate the reanimation process. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, big threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on using control spells and Stoneforge Mystic to manipulate the board state and generate card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing efficient removal spells and powerful planeswalkers, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler allows for flexibility and protection against opponents' spells and strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and cast spells to assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one explosive turn. The deck utilizes rituals, mana accelerants, and tutors to quickly find and play key combo pieces, allowing for a fast and powerful win condition. The deck prioritizes speed and efficiency, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a board presence or disrupt the combo.
